qas.question: What countries prevented the Soviets from joining the Munich Conference?
Who was the English politician who appeased Germany with the take over of Czechoslovakia
The soviets suspected that Nazi-Soviet conflicts would result in what?

answers.text: put an end to both the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany

qas.question: What countries helped the Soviets from joining the Munich Conference?
What countries prevented the Germans from joining the Munich Conference?
Who was the English politician who opposed Germany with the take over of Czechoslovakia
Who was the French politician who appeased Germany with the take over of Czechoslovakia

plausible_answers.text: an end to both the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany

qas.question: The soviets suspected that Nazi-Soviet conflicts would never result in what?

context: Hitler's fierce anti-Soviet rhetoric was one of the reasons why the <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>UK and France<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> decided that Soviet participation in the 1938 Munich Conference regarding Czechoslovakia would be both dangerous and useless. The Munich Agreement that followed marked a partial German annexation of Czechoslovakia in late 1938 followed by its complete dissolution in March 1939, which as part of the appeasement of Germany conducted by <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>Chamberlain<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/>'s and Daladier's cabinets. This policy immediately raised the question of whether the Soviet Union could avoid being next on Hitler's list. The Soviet leadership believed that the West wanted to encourage German aggression in the East and that France and Britain might stay neutral in a war initiated by Germany, hoping that the warring states would wear each other out and <a2_0>put <b7_0>an end to both the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
